FuncDef:
The emdi channel outbound command binds an EMDI channel to the outbound interface.
The undo emdi channel outbound command unbinds an EMDI channel from the outbound interface.
By default, an EMDI channel is not bound to the outbound interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a channel.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the downstream EMDI detection solution is used, after the EMDI channels and boards to be detected are configured and the EMDI channel group is bound to the EMDI board group, run the emdi channel outbound command to bind an EMDI channel to the outbound interface to detect indicators of the EMDI channel in the downstream direction.
Prerequisites
An EMDI channel group has been created using the emdi channel-group command. An EMDI board group has been created using the emdi lpu-group command. The EMDI channel group has been bound to the EMDI board group using the emdi bind channel-group lpu-group outbound command.
Precautions
An EMDI channel can be bound to only one interface on a board. A maximum of 20 EMDI channels can be bound to an interface.
